Reviews.Title: “Best hotel stay!!”
Reviews.Author: Meganj52
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at homewood suites last night and we were very impressed. Great spacious room. Beautiful modern room. Easy valet parking. Great location. Short walk to all resurants and concert venue. Would stay here again no doubt about it

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay downtown”
Reviews.Author: Chelsea M
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to stay here for a little weekend getaway and we had an amazing time! We had planned to spend a lot of our time walking around the city, but frigid temperatures kept us inside a lot of the time and we did not mind a bit. The rooms are warm and inviting, and the decor is absolutely beautiful. The high ceilings and wooden beams in the room definitely cast a unique feel. The history behind the building is also very interesting. The staff is very accommodating, particularly the girl that works overnight. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and will definitely be staying again in the near future. Something else that is noteworthy is the pool. I've been to several hotels claiming to have a heated pools and it ended up not to be so, but theirs is perfect! Also, if you choose this hotel definitely go with the Valet! It is worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here monthly.”
Reviews.Author: Michigan4ever
Reviews.Content: Great location, clean room, high ceilings, great overall experience.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable and stylish hotel”
Reviews.Author: TheGameCrafter
Reviews.Content: This Homewood Suites has a great style and elegance to it. It's a old building that was remodeled and so you have high ceilings (with ceiling fans) and very unique room designs with plenty of the original brick on the walls. The room sizes are great and it's always nice to have the full kitchen when you are staying for a week and attending a convention (GenCon). Homewood Suites have always been nice, comfortable, and offered great amenities. The breakfast was great with a full assortment of hot plate items, cereal, baked goods, and more. Everything was great and we didn't have any issues during our stay. The only thing we did not like was that the Elevators were painfully slow. Sometimes it could take up to 4-5 minutes to get an elevator. We learned that the rear elevator was typically much more responsive (since less people use it apparently) and so that helped after we discovered it.

Reviews.Title: “Great alternative to other hotels”
Reviews.Author: Docproc_11
Reviews.Content: I make a few trips per year to Indianapolis and staying in hotels for a week or more at a time quickly becomes wearing. The Homewood Suites is a nice alternative, with spacious rooms (including cooking facilities if you need them, I didn't) and a simple but good light evening buffet meal weeknights. There is a small gym and a pool, however the pool was closed for most of the time I was there. Staff are generally pleasant, although the standard varies - some of the poorer ones could learn a lot from the better ones. The beds are very comfortable - the best I've ever found in a hotel. This alone would make it worth returning!

Reviews.Title: “The worst Ever!”
Reviews.Author: Goally
Reviews.Content: Nighttime manger just shrugged his shoulders. They really don't care and i suspect that is why the rooms Are dirty and the bathrooms smell. Lots of other choices in this city that I would recommend you consider first. I checked in and promptly checked this one off my list forever.

Reviews.Title: “Cool hotel, great service, perfect location A+++”
Reviews.Author: flamingoette
Reviews.Content: Hotel is an old building with very tall ceilings in huge suites. Beds are comfortable. Amenities are all you could ask for and more, but what really stands out for me at this particular hotel, is the service. Top notch. No request is denied. Just a few examples. At our previous stay we were in town for a bachelorette party right after Thanksgiving, and had left over ham buns that we brought with thinking the rooms had ovens. There were only microwaves, but we called the front desk, and they sent someone up to get the sandwiches, heated them up, and then brought them back to our room. Impressive service. Another example, the only real option at this hotel is valet parking, one of our guests forgot his boots in his vehicle, and when he talked to concierge about where his car was to get them, they just went and got the boots for him, and delivered them to his room. Again, impressive level of service. And the excellent service is offered up, one does not even need to demand it, it is freely given to each guest on every visit we have made to this hotel. Well done Homewood Suites Indy, the friendliness of the staff is indicative of the Midwestern hospitality you will enjoy when you visit this fun little city.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great "feel"”
Reviews.Author: traveling_teacher611
Reviews.Content: Loved the location of this hotel - across from Circle Center Mall, about two or three blocks from the downtown monument circle, and one block from Conseco. Modern rooms but also a lot of character with the exposed brick walls. The room we stayed in was very spacious and clean. No complaints whatsoever. Breakfast was adequate and pretty typical for a continental style set up. Check in was easy. We parked at the garage down the street for a pretty decent rate (I can't remember exactly but I think it was $20 or less/night?). Would definitely stay here again. Have used this hotel two or three times now and am always happy with the staff, cleanliness, and overall quality.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property!”
Reviews.Author: atobrien127
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a prime location--we were able to walk around downtown and to dinner (even in December!) The rooms are very spacious and the bed was really comfortable. I wish we were able to stay more than one night! We were very impressed by the kitchen facilities--a full refrigerator, stove and a dishwasher. Not what you'd expect. The service was also excellent and the complimentary breakfast was a great addition.

Reviews.Title: “Great place UNLESS you have a crawling child”
Reviews.Author: runnermom14
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights with my husband and young baby for Thanksgiving weekend. This is a beautiful, modern hotel. We were very impressed by our room, which was clean and spacious. The complimentary breakfast was also good. We enjoyed our stay...with one exception. My daughter can't walk yet and it wasn't until after two different pairs of clothing were ruined from the dark chocolate brown carpet that I realized I needed to keep her off the floor! There is also only one elevator for the hotel, which proved to be a major hassle when trying to check out on a Sunday morning at 10. I also had an unfortunate experience with a young, unassuming bellhop, but all other services were great. Overall, we would stay here again, but we will wait til our daughter can walk!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best business stays ever!”
Reviews.Author: MNRJSS
Reviews.Content: I was in Indianapolis last January for a 2-day conference. I wasn't thrilled about going to Indianapolis in February. However, this place was amazing and at a great rate. The place is not one of those cookie-cutter business hotels. It is an old building that has been completely remodelled and has a cool, loft-like vibe. My room was enormous, must have had a 30-foot ceiling, and a great kitchenette. I kept looking around my room the whole time I was there! The staff was super friendly, there was a great do-it-yourself breakfast in the morning, a nice stockroom of food to purchase 24 h a day, a great little gym and pool, and an amazing convenient location downtown. I have travelled in every continent (except Antarctica) and at great 5-star hotels. This isn't a 5-star, but for sheer unexpected charm and great value, I periodically remember this place, which is why I decided to write this review 1 year later!! I want the owners of this place and staff to be rewarded for what they have accomplished.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for family”
Reviews.Author: Letsgoracing1
Reviews.Content: Had an enjoyable long weekend stay here. The room was very nice and a great value. The only negative to the room is the lack of windows. Breakfast was good and the staff were all very nice. Unfortunately the pool was very cold. Overall a very good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, clean1”
Reviews.Author: dkaplan435
Reviews.Content: Great food, clean rooms, clean lobby. Kitchen, all the necessities in the room. Wi-Fi was kind of slow...

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place and we're planning on going back”
Reviews.Author: mibaba4
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in August, 2011 for the annual DCI drum & bugle corps championships held at Lucas Oil Stadium. We were nicely surprised by the beauty of the hotel, the friendly staff, and the fact that we ended up with a large suite. We arrived before 8am from a red eye flight, however they checked in our bags right away so we could do some sightseeing without lugging them around. The desk clerks were all very nice and helpful and to our surprise our room was ready by 11am! That was a blessing because we were able to check in early, take a nap and get ready for our events that evening. This hotel used to be a distribution center and it was turned into a hotel and it is considered a landmark. You can still see the beams in the high ceilings. It looks like a decor to me but in fact these are reminders of what the place used to be. When we booked the room it said that it came with a continental breakfast. The truth is you get a full breakfast and there are lots of choices. This hotel is located in an area with a very active night life, which did not bother me because the location is great and convenient to everything. We were able to walk back and forth to Lucas Oil Stadium. If you're lucky to get a room away from the street you will get a good nights sleep. They also have a business center right next to the front desk. I did not use the pool or exercise room so I can not give any opinions on that. I will definitely go back to this hotel and I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “They've Earned My Loyalty!”
Reviews.Author: Unforth
Reviews.Content: This August, I stayed in the Homewood Suites Indianapolis Downtown for the second consecutive year for an annual convention that I go to. Once again, I fund this to be a wonderful hotel. Breakfast was included, as was dinner on weeknights. The fitness area was nice and adeuwate, as was the pool. The staff were uniformly helpful, supportive, friendly, accommodating and professional. One odd thing about this stay - I was assigned to what appeared to be a handicapped suite, in that it had a sign by the door, but I saw no other evidence of handicapped support in the room - normal bathroom, etc. Definitely suggest that handicapped customers check just what accommodations are available for them before booking, because if what I was in really was the handicapped suite it would not be helpful to wheel-chair bound visitors. Did I mention free, good wifi? And room for six people comfortably? And a full kitchen? Love this hotel! Already booked for next August! :)

Reviews.Title: “I can't say enough great things about this hotel”
Reviews.Author: eagvent
Reviews.Content: I'd never been to Indy, so chose the Homewood because it was at an attractive price and was seemingly in a good location. Wow, what a great place! Room: Huge. Paying the lowest rate available when I booked, I was able to confirm a 1BR suite. Not just a studio with a bed and couch in the same room, the bedroom was separated by the living room - and kitchen - by the bathroom. Yes, there was no door between them but there was plenty of separation. Amenities: I'll be staying at Homewood's more often in the future. The hot breakfast had several selections plus drinks, toast, etc. In the evening, open bar for beer and wine for two hours. At that same time, dinner is also available free of charge. Gourmet? No, but everyday that offer a main course, starch and veggie. If you're on a budget, this is big. Location: Perfect. Right off the center of downtown by the stadium, fieldhouse, bars and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Largest hotel rooms in downtown Indy! Fabulous Family/Friends Room!”
Reviews.Author: SPQAB
Reviews.Content: Four friends and I stayed at the Homewood Suites in downtown Indy this past weekend for a girls' getaway. After researching downtown hotels, I booked the room because of the queen beds (opposed to doubles) and because it also had a pull-out sectional sofa. When we travel once or twice a year for more than a night or two, we like to have our own beds, but just for one night in the city, it makes more sense to share one room to keep cost at a minimum. The total for the room was $155.57, but would sleep 6 comfortably and even sleep 7 (with the "L" of the sectional). There would even be PLENTY of room for a queen size blow up mattress, as well. I have 4 kids, and it has become difficult to find a room to accomodate 6 people. This hotel is definitely the place. Not only was there ample space, but the ceilings were extremely high, there was a full size kitchen with stainless dishwasher, sink, stove, and fridge, beautiful cabinets, large TV's, table & chairs to eat at and it was right in the heart of the city. I booked the room also for the proximity to our final destination, Howl At The Moon (dueling piano bar). It was literally out the door and around the corner. We ate dinner at the Old Spaghetti Factory (just across the street from the hotel) and went to HATM just before 7:00. We got a front row tables at center stage. Couldn't have asked for better seating. Homewood had a satisfactory breakfast. Better than most, not as good as some. As I mentioned, I have 4 children, so we always try to stay somewhere with free breakfast (so I've had my share). There were scrambled eggs, sausage patties, french toast sticks (hard as rocks), plenty of fruit, pastries, and cereals, and make your own waffles. Overall - good breakfast. Beautiful lobby and nice business center with two community computers. We didn't get a chance to see the pool area, but I'd like to bring the family back for a chance to experience it, as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for business or pleasure in Indy.”
Reviews.Author: thepearl8
Reviews.Content: The site is located near the Convention Center for conference activities plus several entertainment venues within two blocks. Hotel provides a great breakfast and dinner option to manage your budget. Shopping at Nordstrom is in the next block if necessary. It is definitely on my list of places to return.

Reviews.Title: “Great place close to downtown eateries”
Reviews.Author: Sh0w_Me_Traveler
Reviews.Content: We found the our room very clean and comfortable. The beds were the best sleep I've had in recent stays at other hotels. The location is an easy walk over to Illinois (one block) and access to many fine restaurants and brew pubs within just several blocks. The staff was all very friendly and helpful. The valet even went to our car to fetch our umbrellas as it was raining when we went out. Would stay there again in an instant.

Reviews.Title: “Second stay as good as the first time”
Reviews.Author: Hotelsnob2011
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in 2009 for an audit. I liked it so much that I returned in 2011 for another audit. The hotel was just as great as the first time. The food sucks but you're close to a mall and other restaurants. You also have a full refigerator and microwave to heat up and store leftovers!

Reviews.Title: “Love this Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: sgoodsman
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our annual Indy 500 trip. This is our 5th year staying at the Homewood Suites in downtown Indianapolis. We love this hotel. The rooms are so large with beautiful exposed brick and high ceilings. There is sufficient space for our group to spread out. The location to downtown bars and restaurants is so convienent. The hot breakfasts this year were exceptional. Even with all of the new hotels being built in downtown Indy, we will continue to stay here. If Nebraska makes it into the inaugral Big 10 football championship, we will be back in December.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but you have to be a sound sleeper!”
Reviews.Author: Kittypants
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very nice, recently updated and decorated. Bed comfortable. Flat screen TVs in both the living room and bedroom. Huge bathroom and rooms over all were very large with high ceilings. Too bad the neighborhood is LOUD! Motorcycles roared past throughout the night and drunks squealed on the street below until well past 3 am. On a Tuesday night (and not during the 500). I hardly got any sleep. It is probably quieter during winter. Too bad because the hotel itself was lovely, but I wouldn't stay there again. If you're a sound sleeper give it a try.

Reviews.Title: “1 bdroom really not separate and review your bill for accuracy!”
Reviews.Author: beardogmom
Reviews.Content: Basics: My 4 y.o son and I tagged along w/ my husband on a business trip - Sun to Thursday - 1 bedroom suite via AAA. The good: Great valet service - rather expensive ($24 a day) - but, these guys (who I believe are subcontracted and not hotel employees) do a great job - and each day they offered me driving directions to my destination. Very prompt and courteous service. Great breakfast buffet in the AM (but rather early for me 6 to 9AM) (and see the "ugly" comment below re: unwashed fruit). Each day they have a different "hot" entree and then the usual, toast, bagels, rolls, cereal, yogurt, fruit, hot waffles (machine). Coffees, and juices. Mon - TH evening light dinner buffet - this was nice because my husband was going out and networking and my son and I could grab something quick and easy and not have to be bothered with going out by ourselves. Again, they have one featured item and there is a calendar menu on your fridge in your room to tell you in advance of what they are serviing. FREE beer and wine too! Nice size clean pool area - my son even learned to swim there!!! The elevators are (good) quite quite - we were right next to one and i never heard it in my room: however (bad) they are very SLOW. Two in the hotel. Decor and loft warehouse feel - nicely decorated. Great open kitchen w/ small table w/ 2 chairs; sectional pull sofa - flat screen TV. Large entryway. Adequate size bathroom. The 1 bedroom in sq footage is quite large - we had plenty of room. The Bad (or not so good): We checked in ~5 PM on Sun eve- I asked for a quite room since i have a napper and we all are light sleepers - only 5 floors in this hotel - so something off the main street would have been desirable. The clerk had us originally on 3 rd floor - facing noisy front street and right beside elevator - NOT GOOD. He informed us they were full due to the convention (which my husband was attending). He said he could move us up one floor - so we said - ok, fine; well, this was NOT a 1 bedroom -but, rather the suite room - with everything grouped together and smaller - so I called and said - we need the 1 bedroom; well, he only offered us rthe original room - so ok fine. But, really - i understand they are full - but, not everyone had checked in yet - and he reallly didn't try to relocate us - he seemed rather apathic about my concern for need for a quite room. This may be a good for some -but, for us it wasn't good - the location. You are smack dap in restaurant/bar area - Wholesale district - bars across the street and beside you and down the alley... VERY vERY noicy from 11 pm to 2:30 AM. The police station is just down the block - but, you would never know it. Garbage trucks - from 3:30 to 5 AM every night?! BEEP BEEP BEEP - backing up - than CRASH DUMP - garbage collecting!! uugghhh - not much the hotel can do about these I know - but, sleepers beware!! (This goes to my request for a quite room) No bedroom door - it's all open - i guess to make it more of a loft warehouse feel - but, that is the reason I want a separate bedroom - I want a door! May not be an issue for most - but, for us w/ a small son it was. IN room movie rental: they have a special section for $4.99 (and up*) - well, you have to read the small print - I ended up buying a movie (Shrek) for 9.99 - thinking it was $4.99 and then we could only watch it once? Bed - mattress or bed needed replaced. NO dish soap provided - you had to run the dishwasher to clean a few dishes. The Ugly: Our confirmed AAA rate was $151 a night for 4 nights. When my husband checked out and brought me the bill on Thur AM - I was shocked to see we only rec'd that rate on our 1st night and M and Tu night we were charged more than double and on Wed $171 a night; so, i took my confirmation down to the front desk and asked for a mangaer - I ended up speaking to the Dir of Sales and she was polite and got everything changed but really didn't offer up much explanation for the mishap!? Breakfast buffet - I noticed by the 2nd day that the fruit all had stickers on them still -and upon further inspection yes, they NOT been washed at all. I asked the food service lady and she confirmed that "no, she didn't wash them - they come in a box .... already washed"... ummm NO -they are not washed - and there is no where in the breakfast area to wash them!? She did offer to go wash my apple for me. But, ppl - it's a breakfast buffet - ppl are grabbling apples, pears, etc to sit down and eat or run out the door to eat for a snack later - shouldn't this food all be washed? Isn't that Food service 101? I realized after all this that we had served my son the blueberries the previous day and I am quite certain it wasn't washed either!! GRRRR!! I infomed the Dir of Sales of this on my check out, along w/ the bill mishap and also the lack of concern for my request of a quite room. She did follow up in a few hours with a phone call; but, with basically just another apology and to notify me she had followed up on these items... so, PLEASE - let me know if you readers stay there and see the stickers still on the fruit!! I am so curious to know if that was corrected or not!?

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Location & Service”
Reviews.Author: Spiderdude
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel as we were attending a conference at the JW Marriott. We had the option to stay there, but felt we didn't want to be right on top of it. We were delighted with our stay here. From the moment we arrived the staff could not be more helpful. The rooms are huge, and I mean huge! The beds are comfortable, and street noise is hardly there. Ocasionally you get the odd guest who might not respect that other people are sleeping, but to be honest what hotel doesn't. Breakfast is a simple affair, cooked or continental. Though you can pour your own waffles! Included in the price is an evening meal, although simple they are tasty and included is a selection on wines and beers, with soft drinks for those that choose. All in all great value! Location, is perfect. You are within 5 minutes walk to all the best restaurants and bars. The Circle Shopping Mall is directly across the road and open till 9pm, so shopping available on tap. The Indy Speedway is only 15 minutes drive away as well. All is all I would recommend staying here and would have no trouble doing so again should I be in Indianapolis!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Homewood Suites!”
Reviews.Author: russhhs
Reviews.Content: We were extremely surprised at the size of the rooms here. They were HUGE. A neat place over all, tall ceilings, great furnishings, convenient to everything down town. Fitness center was small, but never more than two people using it. Breakfast was nice, lots of good options. The person working the morning buffet was very efficient and friendly with all the guests. We came back around dinner and our room hadn't been cleaned. This was due to a mix up with house keeping. We called the front desk and the manager came up, the front desk clerk came later with towels and then the head of housekeeping came in and when we came back from dinner our room was clean. Excellent customer service. The building behind us was being renovated and we were right next to it. It was noisy, but c'mon, the hotel can't control that. So other Trip Advisor members, please don't mark down a hotel for something like that ... no way they could tell the contractors next door not to empty their dumpsters or use power tools. Overall a great stay. We will definitely stay here next year when we return for our conference.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, interesting, and located”
Reviews.Author: rojamg
Reviews.Content: Stayed with large group of teenagers, parents, and coaches for a downtown academic competition. Teens devoured the extensive free breakfast. Hotel is recently remodeled warehouse. Big, comfortable rooms. Warehouse architectural elements incorporated into design, i.e. exposed wooden beams and original rustic brick. Valet parking only 4 bucks more than the garage. Located in the heart of the entertainment district, tons of restaurants and drinking holes. Only blocks from both the Pacers and Colts stadiums. Management, If you read this the fake Chia Pet decorations in the rooms are tacky.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience!”
Reviews.Author: Bella_Badger
Reviews.Content: My spouse and I selected this hotel based on Trip Advisor reviews and were not disappointed! Based on pictures, I was worried that the room would be dark, but that was not the case. The rooms have wonderful loft-style high ceilings and beautiful exposed beams. Everything looks very comfortable, clean and chic, from the room to the breakfast/dinner reception area. The price includes free breakfast (with waffles!) and free dinner (with wine!), so you can't beat the value. Though I didn't swim, the pool area looked beautiful, and the exercise room was clean and accomodating. All staff members were very friendly and welcoming (not snobby or uppity). The location is perfect! Just a couple minutes walk to the mall and wonderful restaurants! I will definitely stay here again and will recommend this hotel to friends and family!

Reviews.Title: “Loft style with lots of space”
Reviews.Author: peacepax
Reviews.Content: This is one of my favorite hotels. The only downside is valet is the only convenient option, i think the hotel's parking is a few blocks away., there is no attached garage. However, many benefits with hotel. There is complimentary wine and light meals for dinner (weekdays) and free breakfast. I LOVE the loft style of the hotel rooms, there is so much space and although I never use the full kitchen/fridge, for families it would be another bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel; too noisey”
Reviews.Author: Travelhelp4
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel on three occasions. The first was a weekend trip with hubby to see Cirque show at Conseco. Two others during Circle City classic. We love the room. Full suite with full kitchen appliances. Tall ceilings and great decor, comfy beds. So unlike all other Homewood suites. This one feels like a New York hotel. One major flaw - the noise. Not only noise from the street - other rooms. The walls are paper thin. The back rooms away from the street eliminate street noise, but no view. Our last stay was ruined with noise from people in the other rooms. Not loud noises - TV sounds at moderate levels. Disappointing because I really like this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good for business in Downtown Indy”
Reviews.Author: PCNet
Reviews.Content: I’ve stayed here a couple of times in 2010. The place is clean, staff are friendly. Monday – Friday evenings they offer a free buffet evening meal between 5 & 7pm, it’s not gourmet but does the job. Hotel has a shop that sells ready meals that you can take to your room and cook. Pool area is clean and rarely used. All rooms have good free Wifi. Wifi can also be picked up in business centre and food area. The location is generally good, you can walk to Circle Centre Mall and there are number of great places to eat within a couple of blocks. Parking is a downside, you can either valet park ($24 a night) or go to one of the parking garages in the area that are 5-10 minutes walk away. I personally like the two room suite approach and this place works well for me when I’m travelling on business to Indy.

Reviews.Title: “I Love This Hotel, and Have Already Booked My Next Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Unforth
Reviews.Content: Every year in August, a bunch of my friends and I travel to Indy for a sort-of reunion. Two years ago, one of my friends stayed at the Homewood Suites, and I was so impressed that I resolved that no matter what, I would stay there this year - and it didn't disappoint. With my AAA membership, I was able to book an excellent rate, and for under $200 a night, me and my four friends shared a suite with enough room for all of us to have our own beds (there was a couple involved) and be comfortable, plus a lovely bathroom, great kitchenette with a full-size fridge, sink, and more, and breakfast included! Not only that, but the hotel was very easy to get to by public transit from the airport (my friends who drove had to put their car in the valet, which was $25 per day). The staff were very helpful and supportive, including as regarded a noise incident in the hallway during my stay. The breakfast had a nice range of selections, and if none of it was great, well, it was tasty and free - and I have trouble turning down waffles. :) I also made use of both the pool facility - which was very pleasant and seemed incredibly under utilized, nothing like a pool to oneself! - and the exercise room, which seemed to get crowded in the mid morning but always had room first thing (it included two treadmills, a stationary bike, an elliptical and some free weights). My friends all indicated to me that they were very satisfied, too. When, a few days afterwards, I was notified by the staff that they had opened up booking for the same dates next year? I made my reservation immediately! I know that my friends and I will have a positive hotel stay at the Homewood Suites. :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Wonderful Facility, Spacious Accomodations”
Reviews.Author: MrsSpike34
Reviews.Content: I stay at the Homewood regularly when I am in Indianapolis. The location is great, right on Meridian Street within walking distance of the Circle Center mall, loads of restaurants, night life, the stadium, the Canal, really anything you need. The suites themselves are huge, with wood floors, a kitchenette, separate living area with couch, dinette etc. Each night there is complimentary beer, wine and dinner, although the food is not great, it's free so there is no complaining here. Breakfast is hot and free too. My only complaint is the coffee, it's kind of weak, even the robust blend so I bring Via packets. The place is spotlessly clean, the staff is really super friendly, the only exception to that being the evening guy who mans the free dinner/beer/wine. We call him the dinner nazi, it ends at 7PM and if you are there filling your plate at 7, he will be pulling it out from under you and giving you nasty looks. Everyone else is GREAT! Valet service is very friendly, Josh is great. They are busy in the AM though so call for your car when you leave your room. There are many consultants staying there so they have a lot of cars to bring around. They will go get groceries for you if you put them on your list found on the frig, this is a wonderful service. Also, their dry cleaning service is reasonably priced and fast. The elevator is kind of slow, so if you are in a hurry to get places stay on the first floor, the stairs go to the outside of the building, not the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel - Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: mnhubby
Reviews.Content: This hotel was much better than expected. The rooms had vaulted ceilings with lots of space. They also provide a free continetal breakfast whiich is great for us as we were a party of four. The location is also an added bonus. Right in the city of Indianapolis! I would stay here again if I come to Indianapolis.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Experience”
Reviews.Author: Aeowyn98
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel during the week celebrating our wedding anniversary. The service was great, down to earth and friendly, not snooty. We stayed in a King studio suite, and the room was beautiful! Beautiful decor, very spacious, super comfy bed, our own full service kitchen, big couch and everything was very clean! This hotel has free breakfast each day and free light dinner every weeknight. The location was nice, within walking distance of some good resteraunts and the city centre mall. We walked to Kilroy's pub from the hotel, just a few buildings down, nice pub! The breakfast was a full breakfast with hot & cold foods. The lobby and dining area are beautiful. The front desk has a little "suite shop" where you can buy items that you forgot, or grab snack and a drink if you want. Complimentary coffee and lemonade each day. We didn't get to use the pool or excercise room, but they looked very nice and clean as well. Everything was recently updated so everything looked nice. The room we stayed in was also VERY quiet, and the hotel was booked the nights we were there. I didn't notice much noise and the hotel didn't feel crowded at all. I will DEFINATLY be coming back to this hotel in the future!!!

Reviews.Title: “Damn. Damn nice place!”
Reviews.Author: OSU_Sux
Reviews.Content: Wow. I was impressed with the Homewood Suites in Wichita, KS but this one just took first place. I have not stayed at any other hotel in Indianapolis, but eyeballing some of the other ones, I think this one deserves to be higher than it is. Just a sick feeling from a VERY seasoned traveller and HHonors Diamond. Really. The rooms are absolutely amazing and looking at the condition and cleanliness I was shocked to learn this opened in 2006, it looks like it just opened last year. The locaiton is very central, walking distance to everything. Only two negatives - would be nice since they are downtown, if they had some kind of a little bar with some kind of room service or food arrangement. I get there are places right next door, but sometimes you just want to chill in the hotel. Second, I have a hundred dollar bill the desk couldn't break for me. I know its a pain but I wanted to break it for the valets the next morning, now I'm going to have to work to get money for them, that's a drag. They should have a backup bank in the safe. But that's not all that bad in the grand scheme of things although it is perhaps the difference between it and hotels that ranked above it.

Reviews.Title: “Fourth of July Saturday Night”
Reviews.Author: dsl82899
Reviews.Content: Just a quick review. We had a tough circumstance I need to write about, but take that with respect to our situation with it being a Saturday night and some bad luck. Hotel is in a great location, south of the central downtown about 3 blocks and right on the main scene for bars and the sports complexes if your going to a game. Very close to all sorts of evening life style, restaurants and bars. This could be a huge plus or a negative, kids should be in earlier, before 11pm if you don't want them to see the night life. Adults should love this place and location. It is right in the middle of all the action. The hotel is beautiful, new, and very stylish. The room was awesome, huge 16ft ceilings, or close to, and exposed brick in the bedroom. It was one of the nicest hotel rooms I have ever paid less than $100 for, and it is a suite with a full kitchen etc... Very clean and perfect. We had some very loud neighbors that kept us all up until past 2am and we really didn't complain because it was a party night and we didn't want any hassles with them, so we just outlasted and missed a couple hours of sleep. Our goal was to experience downtown Indy in one night and we accomplished that with just the minor setback. I would recommend this hotel for people who want to experience downtown Indy with out kids on a weekend, and for just about anyone else, business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect hotel for a weekend in Downtown Indy!”
Reviews.Author: loriandryan
Reviews.Content: Had a great time here. Room was clean, beds were comfortable, and there was lots of room. Location is fantastic. The free breakfast was exactly that, a free breakfast - nothing exciting. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Downtown Hotel, great price, and free food & beer!”
Reviews.Author: MetroFighter
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights. Hotel is really nice, beds are extremely comfortable (plenty of pillows to pick from too), big rooms, free breakfast (~6-9am), free dinner/finger foods and beer/wine from 5-7pm, and nice workout room and swimming pool. Definitely would recommend it if staying in the downtown area. Area is fairly quiet on every night except for Saturday night when the streets are filled with people going to the clubs.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: fixingthingsguy
Reviews.Content: Large rooms, though small windows. If you are not spending the whole day in your room, then not a problem! I thought the restoration of the building was done very well. The deco seemed to be custom made with no expense spared to get it perfect especially considering the height of the ceilingsin the building. A lot of thought went into the decor to make it come out right and for that I think this hotel should get a lot of kudos Service was good, people very pleasant and hospitable. Location was good near the convention center. I write this to encourage travelers to partronize it because it is a special kind of hotel

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, such a great refurb of two old buildings”
Reviews.Author: Pir8guy
Reviews.Content: This a great property. Two old buildings in downtown Indy have been beautifully redesigned into a totally unique Homewood Suites. I just had a "suite", but it was very roomy, with very cool 20 ft ceilings! Comfortable bed, very comfortable couch, this was almost the perfect hotel room. The lobby and dining area are really well designed, and the hotel is so, so convenient to both the conference center and literally dozens of restaurants and bars. I would be hard pressed to find any negatives, except for the older TV set. (other rooms have flat screens). I highly recommend this property for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Okay But Not Great”
Reviews.Author: roberts_5007
Reviews.Content: Stayed at hotel for a conference April 6-11th. PROS LOCATION Bedding comfy Room design Pool CONS Business Center-children manopolizing computers for over an hour playing video games. Older people having to wait, reported to front desk. Nothing was done. Dirty utensils for breakfast buffet and manager's reception (VERYdirty) Food not being replaced for manager's reception-chicken slightly cold. Which is a food safety issue! Lack of security and follow through with very DRUNK and VERY noisy patrons of hotel Unfortunately I passed on staying at my regular hotel to try this one out. Have stayed in the Homewood Suites in Seattle which was wonderful that is why I chose this one. Won't come back at all next year to stay here for the conference. Will follow this review with a letter to the Hotel Manager

Reviews.Title: “I'd go back”
Reviews.Author: Whateverv
Reviews.Content: I can only join to the previous reviews that have stressed the homely atmosphere of the rooms. I would only say that they are a bit dark. The best: the bed; really comfortable. Breakfast is maybe a bit scanty but OK, and the light dinner they offer during weekdays is OK too. The wi-fi connection worked fine even from the fourth floor. As someone said before, they make the rooms quite late (I found the chambermaid cleaning my room at 1.30 pm). It didn't bother me but did surprise me a little. The people at the front desk were polite. (But make sure that they make proper note of your requests: I asked one person to call a cab that I needed very early in the morning and they forgot to do it; apparently, the message had not been passed on). In all, a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous gem in downtown Indy”
Reviews.Author: BigDDetroit_MI
Reviews.Content: Homewood Suites is almost like being at home. The staff is very friendly, the hotel is clean and very modern. The wireless Internet speed was fantastic. The whole suite concept is great. My husband and I were traveling with our adult son. My son stayed on the couch and we had our own bedroom. Only downsides are: no door for the separate bedroom. You can see into the bedroom when you access the bathroom. Also, ask for new sheets if you use the sofa bed. They didn't seem that clean. But, the main bed was very comfortable. The stay was waaaay accommodating. Also, having the shopping mall across the street is a bonus. Oh, and go see the bartender at the Omni hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, oversized room, but on a Friday night it is loud!”
Reviews.Author: ItsmeLISA
Reviews.Content: We would definately stay here again. We had a room on the 3rd floor facing Meridian Ave. It was pretty loud, but we were exhausted. If I could sleep there anyone can (I'm a very light sleeper). The room is very large with 2 queens beds and a spacious kitchen. It has 2 tv's- perfect for teenagers. The only downside is no in room wi-fi, but there is in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful, Well-appointed Hotel in Downtown Indianapolis”
Reviews.Author: jonnymint
Reviews.Content: The final night of a 5 day trip to Indiana ended on a high note with a stay at this discreet and ideal hotel. Our first impression was wonderful with the friendly and very efficient front desk staff who had us checked in and headed to our room in no time flat without seeming rushed and smiling all the while. (managing to switch reservation names to accommodate the Hilton Honors member in our party without skipping a beat). Valet service was swift and professional without being cold (just the right mix) All-suites, the rooms are spacious, quiet and comfortable with impressively high ceilings. The bed was tough to leave behind with it's dreamy mattress and light but warm down comforter. Large, flat screen TV's, tasteful decor and quiet rooms all added to the experience. Bathroom towels were plentiful and soft (bad towels can be a spoiler after a nice hot shower). Neutrogena amenities and free high speed internet top off the generous, quality feel. Our room was in the back of the hotel with a view of an abandoned ugly building which could by no means be changed by the hotel. No view was necessary, though, to enjoy this hotel and it's convenient location near plenty of restaurants and downtown's impressive Monument Circle. Great place for a romantic getaway or long term business stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wowed by the Room”
Reviews.Author: Cheeseheads
Reviews.Content: Four of us – two Moms and two daughters – visited the Homewood Suites Indianpolis while doing some college visits. This hotel exceeded our expectations. The location is very good – close to lots of restaurants and across the street from Nordstrom’s. We were wowed by the huge room. The bedroom area had two queen beds, tall windows , and a flat screen TV. The living room had a comfy seating area with large couch and another flat screen TV. Breakfast was included as well as dinner on weeknights. The service was prompt and friendly. We did opt for valet parking at $22/night . The only watchout was that we could really hear the noise at night coming from the bars across the street. If you are a light sleeper, I would ask for a room that does not face the street. Overall, this was an outstanding hotel and we would definitely stay here again. If you are looking for restaurants, we enjoyed Harry & Izzy’s as well as the Weber Grill.

Reviews.Title: “Preferred Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: LizzChicago
Reviews.Content: I travel to Indianapolis every month for business. I usually stay at the Conrad or the Hilton. Neither were available in my budget for my June trip so I opted to try the Homewood Suites. I am so happy that they were not available because I had the best experience at the Homewood Suites. The employees couldn't do enough for you. The valet was super helpful and even drove me to a meeting a few blocks away so I wouldn't have to carry a large box in a dress and heels. They all remembered my name! I've stayed at the Conrad at least a dozen times and they NEVER remember me. I have to use the valet quite a bit because I have meetings downtown and north so I'm always getting my car. Usually I have to wait 10-15 minutes at the Conrad. I never waited more than 5 at the Homewood Suites. I loved my room. It was large enough for me to practice yoga and had a great area for my laptop and work stuff. The bed was very comfortable. I enjoyed that I could also stretch out on the couch and read. The free breakfast was perfect for me. They could offer more fruit but I got enough to get my day going. Going forward I will always stay at the Homewood Suites. It will be my Indianapolis home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Some good, some bad - you decide”
Reviews.Author: RamblinHoosier
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights with wife for leisure. Pros are 1) location - just blocks from the Circle with all the shopping, restaurants and clubs (consider Slippery Noodle for blues). 2) large rooms - not true two room suites with door between but quite large with two TVs. 3) relatively new and nice. 4) kitchenette if you need that. Cons 1) management inept - we were out of our room from 10A to 4P, returned for a nap before dinner only to find still no maid service. Apparently housekeeping starts on the first floor and works their way up (we were on 5). Hotel not near full (? 1/3 at most) so seems they could have gotten to stay overs sooner - maybe this is the most efficient/economical way to do it but unacceptable in our eyes, you may not agree, but major issue for us. 2) elevator very slow and no front stairwell. 3) Wood area in kitchenette sticky both days - ? mop. 4) Returned to room after maid left and dishwasher running - one water glass we had used in it total - so much for economical. 5) breakfast is included in room charge but other than ubiquitous self made waffles the hot portion was pretty rough sledding - plan on continental. 5) may want to rename it the Homeless Suites. Sadly on way to Circle there were 4-5 beggars all the time. Hadn't noted this in Indy before - ? maybe the time of year. Room noise others have noted not a problem on 5th floor but with the poor maid service and really slow elevator (can't imagine if it had been close to full) would avoid top floor. Otherwise hotel reasonable choice for downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay on Saturday Night”
Reviews.Author: GregandRobin
Reviews.Content: Hotel is great, rooms are great, pool is great, location is great -- unless you stay on a Saturday night. The problem: The street directly in front of the hotel is a gathering place for extremely loud motorcycle riders who rev their engines and race down Meridian street all night -- apparently with the Indy police department's blessing. The noise is so bad that the hotel should have warned us in advance. What otherwise would have been a great stay was ruined because the hotel failed in its essential purpose -- we could not sleep.

Reviews.Title: “best value for downtown”
Reviews.Author: Ruby042
Reviews.Content: This hotel was absolutely the best value we could find downtown. The room we stayed in came with a furnished kitchenette and pull out sofa bed, which enabled us to entertain friends while we visited. The location was surprisingly quiet for its location near several popular bars in town. (I don't know what other reviewers were talking about when they complained about noise from outside.) The only disappointment was that our window faced a wall. When we decided to add a third night to our stay, the hotel staff booked us at our original discounted rate before we even had a chance to ask for it.

Reviews.Title: “A+ Choice!!”
Reviews.Author: Go_Purdue_Go
Reviews.Content: We read the reviews and chose to stay there over Indy 500 Pole Day weekend. My husband & I both agreed it was one of the top hotels we've ever stayed in. The charm of the exposed brick & beams and very tall ceilings were amazing. Very comfortable and spacious. It was also within walking distance to some excellent restaurants! My only complaint is that the noise from the nightclub next door was distracting. I woke up several times to the noise. I would have asked to switch rooms, but we were already unpacked and in bed. Be sure to request a room away from that side of the building or bring a white noise machine with you!

Reviews.Title: “Great Downtown Indy Hotel Choice”
Reviews.Author: nationalparks
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great. The building was transformed from a warehouse in 2006 to a very nice hotel with spacious rooms that include full size frig and stove top. The interior brick is original to the old warehouse building. Conseco Field House is 1 1/2 blocks, as well as many restaurants and shopping. Indianapolis has a great downtown. The only downside was the street people that seemed to be on most corners.

Reviews.Title: “The nicest hotel I have ever stayed in!!”
Reviews.Author: sharlak528
Reviews.Content: LOCATION! LOCATION! LOCATION! Within walking distance to everything. Coseco Fieldhouse right around the corner, Hard Rock Cafe right down the street and a great mall right down the street. The service at the hotel was second to none, could not ask for any better service. The hotel was beautiful and a very good buy for the price. The staff made you feel right at home! I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone!!

Reviews.Title: “Great loft living”
Reviews.Author: ann3985
Reviews.Content: This, the first weekend of November, was a busy time in Indianapolis with several conventions and a home game for the Indianapolis Colts - which was what we came for. Hotels were obviously booked up months in advance and although we booked in September we didn't have too many choices. I picked Homewood Suites as it was the closest available hotel to the new Lucas Oil Stadium and didn't expect too much more than the standard generic hotel suite. We were in for a big surprise! The very centrally located suite hotel is housed in a newly renovated heritage building and the suites are huge, have all the modern conveniences but have still lots of character with exposed brick walls, 15 foot ceilings and wooden beams. The lobby and breakfast rooms are huge, besides the daily hot breakfast the hotel provides guests with a free dinner Monday through Thursday. The pool is large enough to swim in and there is a complimentary laundry facility. What more can you ask for?

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, but not that great”
Reviews.Author: BillF
Reviews.Content: If you read the other reviews, you would think this hotel is perfect. However, there are some concerns: 1) valet parking is $22 per day and there are really no other options close by. 2) I had a fax sent, and they lost it, so it had to be resent. 3) At 2 PM in the afternoon, my room was not really. The good stuff is: 1) rooms are very nice, the hotel is new. 2) It is located in a quiet area of the downtown. 3) the evening reception is OK. There are other options in the downtown area. Maybe the Hilton would be a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “loved it except for the noise”
Reviews.Author: norcalang
Reviews.Content: Beautiful rooms with modern decor and above average room additions (full fridge, dishwasher etc) Comfortable beds with huge loft style rooms. Exceptional customer service... However if you are a light sleeper be weary of the fact that you are downtown and right next to a night club open until 3am in the morning. The bass resonates through the rooms if you are so unfortunate to be on the side next to the club. We were there during the Indy GP races and mistook the noise as part of nightly festivities...after three nights of little sleep and a complaint to the night manager we were moved to a better location, still some noise but tolerable. There is no room service but the central location as well as breakfast/light supper provided make up for that. Internet is available in rooms/ wireless only in the lobby. I would be happy to stay there again if I was guaranteed one of the interior rooms to eliminate any sleeping issues due to noise.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing rooms in downtown Indy”
Reviews.Author: DragonflyTrips
Reviews.Content: I stay at the Homewood Suites Downtown Indy quite a bit for business and what a wonderful hotel! It is right in the middle of downtown - within walking distance to many restaurants, shops (mall is right across the street), bars, monuments, and more. The hotel is a refurbished building in the old wholesale district. They kept a lot of the old beams and bricks and used them throughout the rooms and hallways. It's beautiful! The rooms have cathedral ceilings. They are all suites (ask for a one bedroom corner suite - those on the first floor in the back are really nice) with kitchens, living areas, table/chairs, full bath and bedroom. Flat screen tv's in the living area and bedroom. If that's not enough - they offer dinner and beverages from 5:00 to 7:00 every weeknight and breakfast every day. The staff is very friendly and they go out of their way to help you. If there is a problem (as there is at any hotel), just talk to a manager when they're in and they will resolve it for you. This hotel has a couple of loud bars nearby, so don't get a room in the front on Thursday through Saturday nights if the noise will bother you. It is downtown, so you have to expect some noise. Of all of the hotels I've stayed in on my business travels, this one is definitely the best!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay in Indy”
Reviews.Author: JTFortWayne
Reviews.Content: Our family (me, wife, 2 preschoolers, and a 12-year-old) stayed at the Homewood for 2 nights on a road-trip vacation in July. All of us, including the preschoolers, were wowed by the classy suite and lobby area. It was pretty much everything we look for in a good hotel: nice decor, very friendly and helpful staff, exceptionally clean, and a great location -- all for about $150/night. Now for some details: The hotel is pretty new, which meant the decor was very nice: Cherry-finish cabinets in the kitchen&bath, dark quartz countertops, stainless appliances, very nice BR furniture. It was all very clean, which is important to us. My one complaint about the room is that it was a 1BR Suite, but the BR and LR were only separated by a short hallway past the bath. No door=no "private time". The lobby and common areas were well-decorated and clean, and the pool room was pretty neat, with an arched roof. The pool itself was clean and didn't burn your nose with chlorine smell, but I thought it was a little too warm -- it still felt warm even after you'd been in for a few minutes. The manager's reception was pretty good the one night we ate there -- BBQ pork & chicken, potatoes, green beans, cans of beer or Sam Adams on tap. The kids and I ate well and skipped an expensive dinner downtown. Breakfast was a little disappointing, but only because the breakfast at the Chicago Homewood was extraordinarily good. The Indy breakfast was still better than most. The location is very good, being a couple of blocks from Circle Center Mall and Lucas Oil Stadium. We were even able to walk to the zoo, which saved on parking, but if it had been any hotter I'd have probably payed for the parking. Also, it's located on the same block as several bars; once the kids were ready for bed my wife and I were able to go across the street to the Claddaugh Irish bar for some time alone.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: IndianaKris
Reviews.Content: The young man at the front desk when we checked in was not friendly at all and looked at the clock and then seemed to reluctantly look to see if our room was ready. It was two and check-in is listed at four, but most hotels will let you check in a little early. And being in downtown Indy we were really wanting to just park our car and do a little shopping. He said our room was not available and was not very helpful in explaining parking, etc. Fortunately a great lady from the back came running forward and told him he could switch us with another room and we could check in right away. He might have been new. But he did not seem happy at all with our being there at two. The room was gorgeous. The beds are amazing. The suite is huge with a full kitchen, a living area with a flat screen tv. This is a building renovated from two old warehouses and still has much of the charm from the old building with huge ceilings. We were going to a concert to see Neil Diamond at Conseco and this hotel was just a very short walk to Conseco. It is also a very short walk to the downtown Center City Mall. There are many restaurants near the hotel but also many bars. There are homeless people around this area often. But you feel very safe inside the hotel. They have an amazing evening reception during the week. This is really a full meal with salad, and entree, a vegetable, hot cookies, etc. They serve wine and beer with this or lemonade. Victor was amazing. He brought cookies to us right from the oven. We had sweet-n-sour chicken that night. Some nights they even have beef wellington. They also have a very nice hot breakfast in the morning. Victor was so nice and truly seemed to love his job. Parking is either valet or self-park at the Union Station parking garage just about a block from the hotel. It is not included with the room rate. If you self park it is 18.00. I think the valet service is 22.00. This location was perfect for our concert. And the staff, except for the first young man were all so great. The valets, housekeeping, etc, were all very, very friendly and helpful. I would definitely recommend this hotel. They also have a nice heated indoor pool. The hotel was opened in 2006.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: keepsmiling74
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed this hotel. We were in town over July 4th and the location was perfect. This is the best Homewood Suites I have stayed in and I cant wait to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It! Cant wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: meg5078
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel! Right across from spaghetti factory and walking distance to everything. The rooms were very nice and spacious. I loved the tall ceilings and modern decor. I admired how they kept some of the original wooden beams exposed in the rooms and throughout the building. They also had left some old brick exposed(nice detail). The beds were very comfortable. The pool was nice, my daughter had so much fun! I will definitely be returning soon!

Reviews.Title: “Love, Love, Loved It!!”
Reviews.Author: amari02
Reviews.Content: Absolutely love this hotel!! From the moment we walked into the lobby and even more when we entered the room! Great location, walking distance of great restaurants, (just don't eat at Makada's Japanese around the corner!), bars, lounges. The room is HUGE! Modern, beautiful decor, one of the most comfortable beds ever!! The breakfast was great, pool area is nice, and even had a billiards room! Would defnitely stay here again, only next time request a room on the upper floors, gets pretty noisy if you're in a room near the breakfast area with dishes clanking and people walking pass. (Very nice hardwood floors, but noisy at 6am as those with heels are walking past your room!)

Reviews.Title: “Great Suite Hotel in Downtown Indy”
Reviews.Author: DeepUgh
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this property while in Indy for the Mini Marathon and opening day at the Indianapolis Motor Speedway. The hotel is easy to get to from the interstate and we used the painless $22 in/out valet parking. The location was a couple of blocks from our marathon starting corral. Check in was quick even though the desk was busier than a long term suite hotel desk usually is. The room was a 2-queen suite with exposed brick, girders, huge windows and a high ceiling. Two 16x9 TVs, a full kitchen, dining area, comfy beds, free internet, 2 phones, hide-a-bed, and a huge bathroom with quality fixtures. Every part of this room was fresh, clean and in great shape. The complimentary breakfast was great - they even opened it earlier than usual Saturday to accomodate the pre-dawn marathon participant guests! They were short on silverware and glassware due to the high number of hungry runners that descended on them, but they were washing and restocking as fast as humanly possible. The Old Spaghetti Factory is directly across the street - a solid, inexpensive family Italian restaurant chain. Try the Mizithra Cheese with Browned Butter pasta for a delicious carbo load the night before a long run. The only negative thing I can say about this property is that the wait for the elevator was long during check in and check out. This would not be any problem at all when their typical long term customers are in the majority, but when the rooms are full of weekend event goers, there can be a wait. Tip: there's a second elevator at the rear of the property that sits idle at the rear of the property - so take advantage of that!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sendmehome
Reviews.Content: This is a great find in downtown. Close to everything including Circle Center, restaurants, bars, etc. Very spacious rooms with flat screen tvs. Nice kitchen and sofa. The front desk staff was very helpful in allowing me to check in very early. The free breakfast is one the best I have seen. I didn't attend the manager's reception, so I don't know about that. You can park in Circle Center for less than the valet parking.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with LOTS of space!”
Reviews.Author: 2goSomeplace
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed 3 nights at the Homewood in Downtown Indy. The hotel has a great feel from the moment you walk in the door. It is comfortable and has all updated amenities. We were pleasantly surprised at the decor and how much space there was in each room. There is a large couch, table and chairs and a flat screen television in the living room/kitchen area. There is a second television in the bedroom. The beds were very comfortable. The location of the hotel was perfect! We were surrounded by food, shopping and nightlife, not to mention within walking distance of the Dome. The complimentary breakfast was pretty good. It varied slightly from day to day. Valet was a little off at times, and it is costly at $22 per day, but it is worth it if for ease. Would I go back - absolutely! I have already made my reservations!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: olozbal
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. Booked it online after seeing it ranked #1 on this site. We were visiting Indy for the first time ever to see the Colts get robbed by the Patriots. First of all, Indy was a surprisingly beautiful and clean city. Well organized, we loved the town. On to the hotel, the rooms are very modern and stylish. My wife wouldn't let me settle in because she was taking photos for the first 5 minutes of how cool it was. The rooms are laid out very well. The location is perfect, lots of bars, restaurants, and a comedy club all within hundreds of feet of the place. We heard no road or rowdy noises but we were on the back of the hotel. Breakfast was nice, it's all free and it's usually scrambled eggs,bacon, cereal, fruits, plus one of those waffle maker machines. Overall pretty good. Only two complaints- 1. Elevators are the slowest known to mankind. Amazingly slow. We stopped taking them and used the stairs. 2. Shower temp was barely tolerable, talking just warm enough to shower but not a comfortable experience. I should have complained but didn't. It probably was fixable but I guess I'm a wimp.

Reviews.Title: “rooms are huge but can be noisy; no door between the sleeping and sitting areas”
Reviews.Author: Illinois_traveler22
Reviews.Content: first off--the good: the rooms are enormous and nicely furnished and the location is very convenient. it's walking distance from many of the downtown restaurants, just down the block from a mall w/a nordstrom's and carson pirie scott, and an easy drive to the zoo. we used the valet parking and it was great--well worth the $22. the $15 that the hotel charges for parking w/no in and out privileges is the same as what you'll pay at the surrounding garages and lots. breakfast was well-stocked and not crowded. and there was free internet in the room. however, it can be quite noisy esp if you get a street side room. we were on the 2nd floor, right on meridian and both fri and sat night the noise of bikers, revving car engines, thumping music, etc. lasted well past midnight. also, one of our main reasons for getting a suite is to be able to stay up after we put the baby to bed. however, there is no door in these suites between the living area and the sleeping area. the 2 are separated by a bathroom/closet area so you could sit quietly on the couch and read w/a dim light w/out too much light filtering back to the bed area, but still--it's essentially one big room (the rooms are laid out in a straight line, living rm/bath/sleep area). otherwise, the decor was quite nice and everything else was in excellent condition.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!”
Reviews.Author: jbtfuller
Reviews.Content: Great hotel! Everything was top notch for us! Two couples went to enjoy a weekend away from the kids...and we enjoyed our time there. Breakfast was a very nice touch! Not a typical continental breakfast!

HotelInfo.Name: Homewood Suites Indianapolis - Downtown
HotelInfo.Address: 211 S Meridian St, Indianapolis, IN 46225
